messages.title: Driving Money into Local Services
messages.content: Championing investment in our local hospital, schools and police - services I know matter to you and your family.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to champion inward investment into the towns of Bury St Edmunds and Stowmarket to improve local high streets.
Advocating for better transport links to benefit local businesses and residents, including improvements on the A14 and investing in Great Eastern Mainline.
Working with the NFU, Suffolk Wildlife Trust and Stowhealth to protect our local environment.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting the Causes You Care About
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Highlighting local and national campaigns that matter to local constituents such as cancer care and community facilities.
Delivering Brexit as promised, based on the 2016 referendum result.

issues.brexitEurope: Brexit: 'Just Get it Done'. In 2017, I stood on a manifesto to respect the referendum result. At the time of writing, Parliament had delayed Brexit multiple times. Now, we must get Brexit done and move on to losother issues.
issues.education: Investing in our schools to provide our children with the best start in life, creation of 20 new places at the High Suffolk Growing Places pre-school.
issues.environment: Working with the NFU, Suffolk Wildlife Trust and Stowhealth to protect our local environment, such as the Green Canopy for a million trees.
issues.health: Championing investment in our local hospital with additional funding to upgrade its facilities and reduce waiting times.
issues.transport: Committed to bringing £22 million investment to fix the 10 worst stretches of the A14 in Suffolk, making the A14 safer.

community.content: Supporting local businesses like the Regal Theatre in Stowmarket and enhancing community facilities.

contactInformation.address: 10 Hatter Street Bury St Edmunds Suffolk, IP33 1LZ

images.caption: Jo on a recent visit to the Regal in Stowmarket.
Jo with the Transport Minister after the Access for All announcement.
Jo with Dr. Stephen Dunn, CEO West Suffolk Foundation Trust.
Jo testing out the Bury St Edmunds Rickshaw with Councillors Alaric Pugh, Anne Williamson and Patrick Chung at the Older Persons Information Fair in the busy Abbeygate area earlier this year.
